tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE quantum_sensor_maintenance_schedule (
  sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  maintenance_date DATE,
  service_record TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE service_records (
    record_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    service_date DATE,
    service_type VARCHAR(50),
    technician_id INT
);

CREATE TABLE service_records (
    record_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    service_type TEXT,
    service_date DATE,
    service_notes TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE MaintenanceSchedule (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    maintenance_date DATE,
    technician_name VARCHAR(50),
    notes TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES Quantumsensor(sensor_id)
);

CREATE TABLE ServiceRecord (
    record_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    schedule_id INT,
    service_date DATE,
    service_type VARCHAR(50),
    parts_replaced TEXT,
    cost DECIMAL(10, 2),
    FOREIGN KEY (schedule_id) REFERENCES MaintenanceSchedule(schedule_id)
);

CREATE TABLE SensorHistory (
    history_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    history_date DATE,
    description TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES Quantumsensor(sensor_id)
);

CREATE TABLE service_records (
	id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
	service_id INT NOT NULL,
	sensor_id INT NOT NULL,
	date_of_service DATE NOT NULL,
	service_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
	service_details TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE quantum_sensors (
	sensor_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
	sensor_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
	manufacturer VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
	model VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
	calibration_date DATE
);
